p:
A third small group (C”) was represented by Crete oils (
F (
c );
I (
c )), having a similar profile, which cannot be combined with Kos (
H (
c )) oil due to the enormous difference in the chemical composition of the classes. The Iran (
L (
c )) and Morocco (
M (
c )) oils influenced, respectively, the negative and positive scores of PC2 (25.3%): the first oil, the only one outside the confidence interval, was abundant in oxygenated sesquiterpenes (OS), in particular α-cadinol (46.2%) and caryophyllene oxide (25.9%), while the second one was rich of oxygenated monoterpenes (OM), such as endo-borneol (33.0%), bornyl acetate (15.6%), α-terpineol (12%) and α-thujol (10.9%).
